alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 9:18AM CST until February 01 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Colorado, Fort Bend and Austin Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Tuesday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 10/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 17.8 Tue 9 am CST 16.7 16.0 15.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CST.
